    • Method Detail

      • dealCard

        public boolean dealCard​(Card card)
        Description copied from interface: Hand
        The supplied Card is dealt to hand.

        If, when added to the hand, the total score for all cards does not exceed Hand.BUST_SCORE then the card is added to the hand and the method returns true. Otherwise the method returns false.

        Specified by:
        dealCard in interface Hand
        Parameters:
        card - to be added (or rejected) to the hand
        Returns:
        true if the card was added; otherwise false.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Description copied from interface: Hand
        Returns the total score based on the Rank of every card currently held in the hand. Returns 0 if the hand is empty.
        Specified by:
        getScore in interface Hand
        Returns:
        the total score of the hand
        See Also:
        Rank

      • getSuitCount

        public int getSuitCount​(Suit suit)
        Description copied from interface: Hand
        Returns the total number of cards in the hand of the specified Suit

        If there are no cards in the hand whose suit matches that of the supplied parameter the method shall return 0. It should also return 0 if the supplied parameter is null.

        Specified by:
        getSuitCount in interface Hand
        Parameters:
        suit - the suit for which to count the number of cards in the hand
        Returns:
        the total number of cards in the hand of the specified Suit

      • getCards

        public java.util.Collection<Card> getCards()
        Description copied from interface: Hand
        Returns an unmodifiable collection (shallow copy) of all cards currently in the hand
        Specified by:
        getCards in interface Hand
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable collection of all the cards currently in the hand

        Specified by:

        public int getNumberOfCards()
        Description copied from interface: Hand

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from interface: Hand
        Override Object.toString(). Generates a string representing the hand as seen in the output trace. The following are examples of such strings.
        • Empty Hand
        • Hand of 1 cards [2 of Clubs] Score: 2
        • Hand of 2 cards [2 of Clubs, 7 of Diamonds] Score: 9
        • Hand of 4 cards [Ace of Clubs, 4 of Diamonds, Queen of Clubs, Ace of Diamonds] Score: 16
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Hand
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representing the hand as seen in the output trace
